channel.title: SQL Command Set on WETATOR
channel.description: Recent content in SQL Command Set on WETATOR

item.title: Exec SQL
item.description: This command is not part of the Default Command Set. You have to register the SQL Command Set first (see Configuration). Executes the given SQL against the configured database and commits. Parameters sql Specifies the SQL to execute (required). Examples Config (wetator.properties) wetator.db.connections=[db name] wetator.db.[db name].driver=org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver (the jdbc driver of your db) wetator.db.[db name].url=[jdbc:...] (the jdbc url of your db) wetator.db.[db name].user=[user] wetator.db.[db name].password=[password] Create a new table and insert some values Command Parameter Optional Parameter exec-sql DROP TABLE IF EXISTS test_tbl exec-sql CREATE TABLE test_tbl (col1 CHAR(20), col2 NUMERIC) exec-sql INSERT INTO test_tbl (col1, col2) VALUES ('First', 1) exec-sql INSERT INTO test_tbl (col1, col2) VALUES ('Second', 2) Call a stored procedure (ORACLE) Command Parameter Optional Parameter exec-sql BEGIN MYSCHEMA.

item.title: Assert SQL
item.description: This command is not part of the Default Command Set. You have to register the SQL Command Set first (see Configuration).
